channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The good news (154 million deaths avoided) and bad news about childhood vaccines
item.description: A new study points out success stories — and potential obstacles — to bringing vaccines to the world's children.
item.content:encoded:
A new study points out success stories — and potential obstacles — to bringing vaccines to the world's children.

(Image credit: Sanchit Khanna/Hindustan Times)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Early intel assessment says Iran's nuclear program was only set back 'a few months'
item.description: President Trump has said U.S. strikes on Iran obliterated the country's nuclear program. An early intelligence assessment finds the strikes may only have set it back "a few months."
item.content:encoded: President Trump has said U.S. strikes on Iran obliterated the country's nuclear program. An early intelligence assessment finds the strikes may only have set it back "a few months."
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Memorial to Queen Elizabeth II in London will feature a bridge reminiscent of her tiara
item.description: Foster + Partners architecture firm beat out four competitors to design the memorial, which will also feature statues of the queen and her husband Prince Philip.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

Foster + Partners architecture firm beat out four competitors to design the memorial, which will also feature statues of the queen and her husband Prince Philip.

(Image credit: Foster + Partners)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A Possible Iran-Israel Ceasefire and Why China is Watching the War Closely
item.description: President Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran on social media and the agreement was immediately tested. We'll hear the latest. And China has been watching developments in the war closely because gets much of its crude oil imports from Iran through a "dark fleet" of vessels to evade American sanctions.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran on social media and the agreement was immediately tested. We'll hear the latest. And China has been watching developments in the war closely because gets much of its crude oil imports from Iran through a "dark fleet" of vessels to evade American sanctions.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: 'A lid on a pot': How does a heat dome work?
item.description: "If you've made grilled cheese in a pan and you put a lid on there, it melts the cheese faster because the lid helps trap the heat," a National Weather Service official told NPR.
item.content:encoded:
"If you've made grilled cheese in a pan and you put a lid on there, it melts the cheese faster because the lid helps trap the heat," a National Weather Service official told NPR.

(Image credit: Esri, TomTom, Garmin, FAO, NOAA, USGS, EPA, USFWS)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Long and short-term solutions to keep yourself and your home cool in a heatwave
item.description: Much of the Midwest and the East Coast are under a heat advisory or warning this week as dangerous heat continues. Here's how to stay cool.
item.content:encoded:
Much of the Midwest and the East Coast are under a heat advisory or warning this week as dangerous heat continues. Here's how to stay cool.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib/AP)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Why is China so concerned about Israel-Iran tensions?
item.description: China is closely watching whether Israel and Iran can broker a ceasefire. Beijing gets much of its crude oil imports from Iran through a "dark fleet" of vessels to evade American sanctions.
item.content:encoded:
China is closely watching whether Israel and Iran can broker a ceasefire. Beijing gets much of its crude oil imports from Iran through a "dark fleet" of vessels to evade American sanctions.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: NTSB faults Boeing for lack of safety protocols in 737 Max door plug blowout
item.description: The nation's top safety investigators concluded there were multiple systemic failures that led to a midair blowout during the flight of an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max jet last year.
item.content:encoded:
The nation's top safety investigators concluded there were multiple systemic failures that led to a midair blowout during the flight of an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max jet last year.

(Image credit: NTSB handout)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: What to know about 'Alligator Alcatraz,' Florida migrant detention center in progress
item.description: Florida's attorney general says the facility is on track to open in early July, at a little-used airfield in the Everglades. Environmental activists hope they can repeat history and stop the project.
item.content:encoded: Florida's attorney general says the facility is on track to open in early July, at a little-used airfield in the Everglades. Environmental activists hope they can repeat history and stop the project.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell says tariff uncertainty warrants caution on rate cuts
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, under continued attack from President Trump, says the impact of tariffs on inflation should become clearer in the coming months.
item.content:encoded:
Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, under continued attack from President Trump, says the impact of tariffs on inflation should become clearer in the coming months.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
